text: I beg your pardon.
title: Top Hat

text: Good evening.
title: Top Hat

text: - Good evening.- Good evening, Mr. Hardwick.
title: Top Hat

text: - Has Mr. Jerry Travers come in yet?- Yes, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: He's been waiting for youthe entire evening, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: The entire evening? Oh, dear.
title: Top Hat

text: Thanks.
title: Top Hat

text: Begging your pardon, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: But is that the Mr. Travers,the well-known American gentleman, sir?
title: Top Hat

text: It is indeed.
title: Top Hat

text: He's come over to star in my show.It's his first London appearance.
title: Top Hat

text: Your show, Mr. Hardwick?
title: Top Hat

text: I'm producing it.
title: Top Hat

text: But I don't wantany of the members here to know.
title: Top Hat

text: I want to surprise them.
title: Top Hat

text: I'm sure they'll be surprised,Mr. Hardwick.
title: Top Hat

text: Hello, Jerry. I'm sorry I kept you waiting.
title: Top Hat

text: Jerry, there are a lot of thingsthat I have to discuss.
title: Top Hat

text: So I want you to come overto my hotel now.
title: Top Hat

text: What happened?
title: Top Hat

text: Jerry, I forgot to tell you.I want you to stay here for the night.
title: Top Hat

text: I'm sorry, I can't do it.
title: Top Hat

text: But you must, old man, really.
title: Top Hat

text: You see, at the moment, I'm havinga sort of a problem with my valet.
title: Top Hat

text: What do you want me to do,press your pants?
title: Top Hat

text: No. You wouldn't know how.
title: Top Hat

text: No, you don't understand.It's my man, Bates.
title: Top Hat

text: - We've had a bit of a tiff.- How terrible.
title: Top Hat

text: - You didn't come to blows or anything?- Nothing like that.
title: Top Hat

text: We're not speaking to each other.We've had rather a clash of taste.
title: Top Hat

text: You see, Bates insists that a square tie...
title: Top Hat

text: is the only possible tiethat can be worn with evening clothes.
title: Top Hat

text: A square tie, imagine.I prefer the butterfly.
title: Top Hat

text: - I think Bates is right.- Bates is never right.
title: Top Hat

text: - Well, then why don't you fire him?- That's a little difficult.
title: Top Hat

text: I'm hoping against hopethat the man will just disappear.
title: Top Hat

text: I hate to interferein these little family squabbles.
title: Top Hat

text: But let's hope he'll approve of me.
title: Top Hat

text: There's never any telling with Bates.
title: Top Hat

text: There you are.
title: Top Hat

text: If you please.
title: Top Hat

text: - Good evening, sir.- Good evening.
title: Top Hat

text: Allow us to introduce ourselves, sir.We are Bates, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: Really?
title: Top Hat

text: - We are Jerry Travers.- Welcome to our mï¿½nage.
title: Top Hat

text: Thank you, Bates.It seems that I'm to stay here tonight.
title: Top Hat

text: At least that was the ideaof our beloved impresario.
title: Top Hat

text: Whose idea?
title: Top Hat

text: Mr. Hardwick's.
title: Top Hat

text: His idea.
title: Top Hat

text: Welcome anyhow.
title: Top Hat

text: Thank you, Bates.
title: Top Hat

text: Pardon, sir, but may we makea personal observation?
title: Top Hat

text: - Not too personal.- No, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: It's merely that we feel impelledto compliment you, sir...
title: Top Hat

text: upon your excellent taste in ties.
title: Top Hat

text: - They like me.- You never know.
title: Top Hat

text: Where on earth did you ever find him?
title: Top Hat

text: From the Salvation Army,as a matter of fact.
title: Top Hat

text: I sent them a pair of very old shoes.
title: Top Hat

text: I see. And the shoes came backand Bates was in them.
title: Top Hat

text: And he's been wearingmy good ones ever since.
title: Top Hat

text: - How's Madge feeling?- She's fine. Thanks, Jerry.
title: Top Hat

text: The climate at the Lidohas done her a lot of good.
title: Top Hat

text: That's fine. Too bad she won't be herefor the opening tomorrow night.
title: Top Hat

text: Isn't it? She's heartbroken, really.
title: Top Hat

text: However, she's expecting us to fly downto Italy for a weekend.
title: Top Hat

text: Fly down to Italy for a weekend?I can't. I haven't got any goggles.
title: Top Hat

text: My word, Jerry, you'll have to go.She's counting on us.
title: Top Hat

text: She's going to havea young friend visit her.
title: Top Hat

text: I suspect there's something in the air.
title: Top Hat

text: You know Madgeand her matchmaking proclivities.
title: Top Hat

text: Is she expecting mefor a weekend or a wedding?
title: Top Hat

text: You can't tell. You know how wives are.
title: Top Hat

text: No, I don't. How are they?
title: Top Hat

text: Wives? They always have a little scheme.
title: Top Hat

text: Look here, I think it's about timeyou found out for yourself.
title: Top Hat

text: - You do?- I certainly do.
title: Top Hat

text: No, thanks, Horace.
title: Top Hat

text: In me you see a youthwho's completely on the loose.
title: Top Hat

text: No yens, no yearning.
title: Top Hat

text: Hello. This is Miss Tremont.
title: Top Hat

text: I'd like to speakto the manager immediately.
title: Top Hat

text: Hello. Are you there?
title: Top Hat

text: Who? The manager. Yes.I can't hear a word you're saying.
title: Top Hat

text: There's a young lady downstairs.
title: Top Hat

text: A young lady. At this time of night?
title: Top Hat

text: She can't come up here now.No, I'd better come down myself.
title: Top Hat

text: Jerry, go right ahead.
title: Top Hat

text: A young lady downstairsevidently wants to see me.
title: Top Hat

text: Hello.
title: Top Hat

text: Won't you come in?
title: Top Hat

text: I'm awfully glad you dropped in.
title: Top Hat

text: I dropped up from the room below,where I've been trying to get some sleep.
title: Top Hat

text: I'm sorry.I didn't realize I was disturbing you.
title: Top Hat

text: You see, every once in a while,I suddenly find myself...
title: Top Hat

text: dancing.
title: Top Hat

text: I suppose it's some kind of an affliction?
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, it's an affliction.
title: Top Hat

text: St. Vitus' dance.
title: Top Hat

text: And it only occurs at this time of night?
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, that's it.It only occurs at this time of night.
title: Top Hat

text: As a matter of fact,I really shouldn't be left alone.
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, I can see that.
title: Top Hat

text: You probably should havea couple of guards.
title: Top Hat

text: I think you're very unkindto make fun of me.
title: Top Hat

text: I'm sorry.
title: Top Hat

text: - I wish you wouldn't leave.- Why not?
title: Top Hat

text: I think I feel an attack coming on.
title: Top Hat

text: See, there it is.
title: Top Hat

text: So I see.
title: Top Hat

text: There's only one thing that'll stop me.
title: Top Hat

text: You must tell me what it is.
title: Top Hat

text: My nurses alwaysput their arms around me.
title: Top Hat

text: I'll call the house detectiveand tell him to put his arms around you.
title: Top Hat

text: Good night.
title: Top Hat

text: What are you doing here?What are you carrying that for?
title: Top Hat

text: - Who was the young lady?- What young lady?
title: Top Hat

text: That call wasn't for me. It was for you.
title: Top Hat

text: Somebody has registered a complaint.
title: Top Hat

text: I know. I've just seen the complaint.
title: Top Hat

text: She's lovely, she's delightful,she's charming, and she wants to sleep.
title: Top Hat

text: She does?
title: Top Hat

text: And I'm going to help her,and you're going to help me. Take this.
title: Top Hat

text: No, bring it in hereand guard it with your life.
title: Top Hat

text: - What are you going to do?- Never mind.
title: Top Hat

text: Look here, what's the idea?
title: Top Hat

text: The young lady downstairs wants to sleep.
title: Top Hat

text: So you told me.
title: Top Hat

text: I've appointed myself her official sandman.
title: Top Hat

text: But, Jerry...
title: Top Hat

text: What else have you got?
title: Top Hat

text: I'm sorry, sir,but you've cleaned out the shop.
title: Top Hat

text: You better tell themto plant some more for tomorrow.
title: Top Hat

text: They are all to goto Miss Dale Tremont, sir?
title: Top Hat

text: That's right.
title: Top Hat

text: Her room number is 304.
title: Top Hat

text: What's that?
title: Top Hat

text: That's for the openingof a butcher shop, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: - Send that up, too.- But, sir, a horseshoe?
title: Top Hat

text: Why, yes, I may want to ordera peach orchard tomorrow.
title: Top Hat

text: What's the number of your room, sir?
title: Top Hat

text: Just charge it to Horace Hardwick,room 404.
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: I wonder what Mr. Beddiniis going to say about this.
title: Top Hat

text: What can he say?
title: Top Hat

text: He's been sending her flowers dailyever since they came here.
title: Top Hat

text: And entre nous...
title: Top Hat

text: the desk clerk has intimated...
title: Top Hat

text: that Mr. Beddini provides Miss Tremontwith all the niceties...
title: Top Hat

text: including her clothes.
title: Top Hat

text: Really?
title: Top Hat

text: And her niceties are very nice.
title: Top Hat

text: - Good morning.- Good morning.
title: Top Hat

text: - I do hope you slept well last night.- I slept well enough, but not long enough.
title: Top Hat

text: I'm sorry. I was hoping...
title: Top Hat

text: there was something I could doto square myself.
title: Top Hat

text: That's quite all right.
title: Top Hat

text: I thought perhaps I could drive youto the stables.
title: Top Hat

text: No, thank you. I have a hansom cabwaiting for me outside.
title: Top Hat

text: With a horse in front of it?
title: Top Hat

text: Yes. You see,the stable people always use them.
title: Top Hat

text: They feel the horse is coming back.
title: Top Hat

text: Where's he been?
title: Top Hat

text: We're leaving tonight.Has Mr. Beddini made arrangements?
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, Miss Tremont.
title: Top Hat

text: He's ordered your baggageto be picked up at 7:00.
title: Top Hat

text: Thank you.
title: Top Hat

text: - Driver.- Yes, miss?
title: Top Hat

text: Can't you go any faster than this?
title: Top Hat

text: Lord love a duck, miss. I can,but I'm not allowed to leave the horse.
title: Top Hat

text: I meant the horse, of course.
title: Top Hat

text: It's like this, miss.You see, the horse is kind of tired today...
title: Top Hat

text: on account of having wonthe Grand National on Friday.
title: Top Hat

text: Are you trying to tell methat this is a racehorse?
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, miss, and I've got his pedigree, too.
title: Top Hat

text: As a matter of fact,his sire was Man O'War.
title: Top Hat

text: Who was his dam?
title: Top Hat

text: - I beg your pardon, miss?- I said, who was his dam?

text: I don't know, miss. He didn't give a...
title: Top Hat

text: Peekaboo.

text: Stop this cab at once.
title: Top Hat

text: I don't know how.
title: Top Hat

text: I've never handled anythingmore complicated than a Duesenberg.

text: Take it easy, Mavis.
title: Top Hat

text: What are we going to do?
title: Top Hat

text: In dealing with a girl or horse,one just lets nature take its course.
title: Top Hat

text: There we are, miss.
title: Top Hat

text: I told you the horsewould bring you to the right place.
title: Top Hat

text: What is this strange poweryou have over horses?
title: Top Hat

text: Horsepower.
title: Top Hat

text: Don't I even get any thanks?
title: Top Hat

text: Buy yourself a new hat.
title: Top Hat

text: Cab, miss?
title: Top Hat

text: May I rescue you?
title: Top Hat

text: No, thank you, I prefer being in distress.
title: Top Hat

text: Charming little spot you have here.
title: Top Hat

text: When does the concert start?
title: Top Hat

text: Just as soon as you and the rain stop.
title: Top Hat

text: Now, please.
title: Top Hat

text: You wouldn't like to bejust a little bit more friendly, would you?
title: Top Hat

text: Why should I?I don't know you from Adam.
title: Top Hat

text: Maybe it's the way I'm dressed.
title: Top Hat

text: Are you afraid of thunder?
title: Top Hat

text: No, it's just the noise.
title: Top Hat

text: You know what thunder is, don't you?
title: Top Hat

text: Of course.
title: Top Hat

text: It's something about the air.
title: Top Hat

text: No, when a clumsy cloud from heremeets a fluffy little cloud from there...
title: Top Hat

text: he billows towards her...
title: Top Hat

text: she scurries awayand he scuds right up to her.
title: Top Hat

text: She cries a little...
title: Top Hat

text: and there you have your shower.
title: Top Hat

text: He comforts her.
title: Top Hat

text: They spark.
title: Top Hat

text: That's the lightning.
title: Top Hat

text: They kiss.
title: Top Hat

text: Thunder.
title: Top Hat

text: Who is sending you this horse's shoe?
title: Top Hat

text: How cute.
title: Top Hat

text: Alberto, I've seen him.I've talked to him. I've danced with him.
title: Top Hat

text: - Him? Who is this him?- Who?
title: Top Hat

text: His name is Adam.
title: Top Hat

text: You forget this Adam.
title: Top Hat

text: You have promised to go with me to Italy.
title: Top Hat

text: Your friend Madge Hardwickis awaiting you.
title: Top Hat

text: There, you will dazzle the eyesin clothes designed by Alberto Beddini.
title: Top Hat

text: Alberto, I hope you don't mind,but I'm not going to the Lido.
title: Top Hat

text: Madre mia. What you say?
title: Top Hat

text: My dear, listen to me.We have made agreement.
title: Top Hat

text: Beddini designs the clothes...
title: Top Hat

text: which you wear among your friends,the smart people.
title: Top Hat

text: So that they ask:
title: Top Hat

text: "Who is so smartas to make these smart clothes?"
title: Top Hat

text: And you say,"Who? Who is so smart? Beddini. "
title: Top Hat

text: Forget this Adam. Beddini demands it.
title: Top Hat

text: Beddini does, does he?
title: Top Hat

text: Alberto, up to the present, our relationshiphas been purely a business one.
title: Top Hat

text: But if you start interferingin my personal affairs...
title: Top Hat

text: I'll go back to Americaand live on the dole.
title: Top Hat

text: Now, Dale darling, I'm so sorry.I did not mean to interfere.
title: Top Hat

text: Go ahead, fall in love with this Adam.Marry him.
title: Top Hat

text: But, as Mrs. Adam, what would you wear?
title: Top Hat

text: Fig leaves.
title: Top Hat

text: Thank you, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: Dale, a telegram for you.
title: Top Hat

text: Read it to me, please.
title: Top Hat

text: "Come ahead, stop.
title: Top Hat

text: "Stop being a sap, stop.
title: Top Hat

text: "You can even bring Alberto, stop.
title: Top Hat

text: "My husband is stoppingat your hotel, stop.
title: Top Hat

text: "When do you start, stop. "
title: Top Hat

text: I cannot understand. Who wrote this?
title: Top Hat

text: Sounds like Gertrude Stein.
title: Top Hat

text: No, it's from Madge Hardwick.
title: Top Hat

text: She says her husband is stoppingat this hotel and will look you up.

text: Wonder what kind of man Madge married.
title: Top Hat

text: He's sure to have influence.Let's be nice to him.

text: I'm going to be too busybeing nice to somebody else.

text: Dale, you can't do this.

text: All my life I have promised my dressesto take them to Italy...
title: Top Hat

text: and you must be in them.
title: Top Hat

text: Sorry, Alberto, but I'm unpacking.

text: - Good evening, Miss Tremont.- Good evening.
title: Top Hat

text: Mr. Beddini and I have decided to stay.
title: Top Hat

text: I'm so glad. Then I'll cancel the orderabout the bags.
title: Top Hat

text: Thank you. Is there a Mr. Hardwickstopping at this hotel?
title: Top Hat

text: Why, yes, Miss Tremont.Mr. Hardwick has room 404.
title: Top Hat

text: Just above you.
title: Top Hat

text: - Are you sure?- Definitely, miss.

text: As a matter of fact,there's Mr. Hardwick now...
title: Top Hat

text: on the mezzanine.
title: Top Hat

text: The gentlemanwith the briefcase and cane.
title: Top Hat

text: - Horace, here's a telegram for you.- For me?
title: Top Hat

text: - It's from Italy.- Italy? That's probably from Madge.
title: Top Hat

text: There's a message in your roomto call the box office.
title: Top Hat

text: Some trouble about the ticketsor something.

text: Trouble? With the tickets?
title: Top Hat

text: My word, Jerry. Why, they wouldn't dare.
title: Top Hat

text: Will you hold those things for me please?Get a taxi and I'll meet you downstairs.

text: All right.
title: Top Hat

text: Cab, miss?
title: Top Hat

text: When a clumsy cloud meetsa fluffy little cloud.
title: Top Hat

text: We're only tryingto investigate matters, miss.

text: We must protect our guests.
title: Top Hat

text: There's nothing to investigate.Nothing matters, nothing's happened.

text: Will you please askthese gentlemen to go?

text: You mean to tell methat girl slapped your face...
title: Top Hat

text: in front of all those people for nothing?
title: Top Hat

text: What would you have done, sold tickets?
title: Top Hat

text: I mean, you did nothing,and yet she slapped your face?
title: Top Hat

text: - Now you're getting it.- I wish you'd be serious about this.
title: Top Hat

text: One breath of scandal at this timewill ruin our show.
title: Top Hat

text: Why, I'd rather have had it happento me than to you.
title: Top Hat

text: - Lf you enjoy that sort of thing.- I do, immensely.
title: Top Hat

text: Don't be absurd.
title: Top Hat

text: I hate men. I hate you. I hate all men!

text: But cara mia, you make a big mistake.
title: Top Hat

text: I am no man.
title: Top Hat

text: I am Beddini.

text: already he has eaten the apple?
title: Top Hat

text: Yes.
title: Top Hat

text: I will kill him for you.

text: Have you finished packing?

text: But you do not understand.
title: Top Hat

text: Are we leaving or aren't we?
title: Top Hat

text: No, you cannot go back to America.We must go to the Lido.

text: But I can't face his wife.

text: And, after all, you can't avoid seeingMadge sometime, can you?
title: Top Hat

text: I guess not.

text: All right. Maybe she ought to know.

text: You're sureyou didn't forget yourself in the park?
title: Top Hat

text: If I ever forgot myself with that girl,I'd remember it.

text: - We're the management.- Are you?

text: Oh, dear. Some moreof these plural personalities.

text: Just a moment.

text: Jerry, get into my bedroom, quick.No one must know you're here.

text: If they ever suspect that you're in this,it'll be in every newspaper in an hour.
title: Top Hat

text: Well, gentlemen,this is a pleasant surprise.

text: A small matter of great importhas come to our attention, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: I am up here in your interestand to protect the hotel.

text: Not Mr. Hardwick.

text: - Good night.- Good night.

text: Bates, thank you.

text: There's a crisis afoot.Couldn't we bury the hatchet?

text: Mr. Travers is in trouble.

title: Top Hat

text: But things are getting involved.This is a deep-laid plot.

title: Top Hat

text: - Hello.- Madge, darling...
title: Top Hat

text: I wanted to call youand tell you I just got married.
title: Top Hat

text: You got what?I'm sorry, dear, I can't hear you.
title: Top Hat

text: It sounds just as if you saidyou got married.
title: Top Hat

text: - I did.- Where are you now?
title: Top Hat

text: Going to the bridal suite?
title: Top Hat

text: Very proper placefor a bride and groom, isn't it?
title: Top Hat

text: Darling, I must compliment youon your speedy work...
title: Top Hat

text: but who on earth did you findto marry you so quickly?
title: Top Hat

text: Alberto? You'd better hang up, Dale, dear.
title: Top Hat

text: - I think I'm going to faint.- Dale.
title: Top Hat

text: What was that?
title: Top Hat

text: - Dale Tremont married?- Yes, to that dressmaker.
title: Top Hat

text: - Good.- Good? What did you have to do with this?
title: Top Hat

text: - It's all his fault.- My fault?
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, she told me how you chased herin the park and she slapped your face.
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, but I'm the one she slapped.
title: Top Hat

text: She's been mistaking mefor Horace all this time.
title: Top Hat

text: No wonder she thoughtHorace was fascinating.
title: Top Hat

text: No wonder. I resent that.
title: Top Hat

text: - Madge, where is she now?- On her way to the bridal suite.
title: Top Hat

text: Bridal suite.
title: Top Hat

text: I'll see you later.
title: Top Hat

text: But, Jerry, you can't do a thing like that.It isn't fair.
title: Top Hat

text: All is fair in love and war,and this is revolution.
title: Top Hat

text: - Yes, this is very pretty.- Thank you, dear sir.
title: Top Hat

text: We are very proudof our bridal arrangements.
title: Top Hat

text: Is there anything else, sir?
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, would you please ask my wifeto join me here?
title: Top Hat

text: It is a pleasure, dear sir.
title: Top Hat

text: What are you doing here?
title: Top Hat

text: - What are you doing here?- Yes, but this is my room.
title: Top Hat

text: - Yes, but this is my room.- But I have the key.
title: Top Hat

text: But I have the key.
title: Top Hat

text: - But I am Beddini.- You got me there, pal.
title: Top Hat

text: We will see who is the owner of this room.
title: Top Hat

text: But, Jerry, you shouldn't be in here.
title: Top Hat

text: - It isn't cricket.- No, Horace, it isn't tiddlywinks either.
title: Top Hat

text: Signor, there is a man in my bed.
title: Top Hat

text: It's too bad. He's not here yet.
title: Top Hat

text: I'll just wait until my uncle returns.
title: Top Hat

text: Thank you.
title: Top Hat

text: Why, Jerry, I didn't knowthat you had an uncle here.
title: Top Hat

text: - Didn't you know?- No.
title: Top Hat

text: I haven't, but this room isjust above the bridal suite.
title: Top Hat

text: He's not here, signor.If he returns, you will call us.
title: Top Hat

text: If he returns, I will kill him.
title: Top Hat

text: We Beddini have the motto:For the woman, the kiss.
title: Top Hat

text: For the man, the sword.
title: Top Hat

text: Dale, you are lovely.
title: Top Hat

text: Like a flower I am afraid to crush.
title: Top Hat

text: Don't be afraid.
title: Top Hat

text: Alberto, make him stop!
title: Top Hat

text: Who is it? You know?
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, it's Horace.
title: Top Hat

text: Horace Hardwick, that interloper.
title: Top Hat

text: I'll stop him.
title: Top Hat

text: For the man, the sword.
title: Top Hat

text: Mrs. Hardwick's apartment, please.
title: Top Hat

text: - He's coming.- Is he?
title: Top Hat

text: You keep this up and hold himhere as long as you can.
title: Top Hat

text: I will.
title: Top Hat

text: Madge, you'd better come overand rescue Horace.
title: Top Hat

text: Alberto has gone after him with a sword.
title: Top Hat

text: Why, yes, of course.
title: Top Hat

text: I'm sorry to break in like this,but I simply had to see you.
title: Top Hat

text: Will you please stop annoying me?
title: Top Hat

text: But you've been mistaken about me.
title: Top Hat

text: - I'm afraid I haven't.- All right, then.
title: Top Hat

text: I'll stay right here and there will bea scene with your husband.
title: Top Hat

text: He'll be furious if he finds you here.
title: Top Hat

text: Then please come with mefor a few minutes.
title: Top Hat

text: I've simply got to talk to you.
title: Top Hat

text: And so you see, my dear chap,I am definitely the wrong person.
title: Top Hat

text: - But you are Horace Hardwick, no?- Yes, of course I am Horace Hardwick.
title: Top Hat

text: Then you are notthe wrong person. Prepare.
title: Top Hat

text: Don't mind me.I just came up to see the fun.
title: Top Hat

text: Madge, explain to this maniac thathe is making a very serious mistake.
title: Top Hat

text: He may be making a mistake,but it's not serious.
title: Top Hat

text: Go right ahead, Alberto.
title: Top Hat

text: No, I cannot kill him before a lady.
title: Top Hat

text: If you're going to pull out on us, Alberto,maybe it's best that you don't kill him.
title: Top Hat

text: I may want that pleasure myself someday.
title: Top Hat

text: But why didn't you tell me who you were?
title: Top Hat

text: After all, I mean, you never gave mevery much of a chance.
title: Top Hat

text: Mr. Travers!
title: Top Hat

text: Help, somebody.
title: Top Hat

text: I am so sorry.I really did not want to kill you.
title: Top Hat

text: - You must forgive me.- I forgive you.
title: Top Hat

text: Go right ahead, boys, don't mind me.
title: Top Hat

text: Not tonight, Alberto.
title: Top Hat

text: Some other timewhen I'm feeling stronger.
title: Top Hat

text: Thank you.
title: Top Hat

text: - Pardon me, sir.- What is it? What's the matter?
title: Top Hat

text: What have you been doing?
title: Top Hat

text: Pardon me, sir,Mr. Travers and Miss Tremont, sir...
title: Top Hat

text: they're drifting out to the bayin a gondola, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: There. That ought to make youfeel pretty small, accusing me.
title: Top Hat

text: - He's kidnapped her.- Kidnapped her?
title: Top Hat

text: You are in this plot.You are cahooting with him.
title: Top Hat

text: I've had just about enough...
title: Top Hat

text: Children, if Dale and Jerryare drifting out to sea...
title: Top Hat

text: don't you think the best thingwe could do is rescue them?
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, come.
title: Top Hat

text: Isn't it marvelous to have some brains?I'm always so helpless.
title: Top Hat

text: Don't answer me like that. Do something.
title: Top Hat

text: - Jerry.- That isn't Jerry.
title: Top Hat

text: That's right. Make a fool of yourself.
title: Top Hat

text: It's no crime to look, is it?
title: Top Hat

text: - I think there is no gas left.- My word, no petrol?
title: Top Hat

text: Perhaps I'd better look at the engine,where is it?
title: Top Hat

text: They may have hidden it up thereunder the hood.
title: Top Hat

text: This is the first timeI ever had to walk back from a boat ride.
title: Top Hat

text: Jerry, you mustn't come with me.I'd rather talk to Alberto alone.
title: Top Hat

text: Alberto will have to get accustomedto talking in front of me.
title: Top Hat

text: No, seriously,I'd rather you wouldn't. Please.
title: Top Hat

text: When am I going to see you again?
title: Top Hat

text: I don't know.
title: Top Hat

text: Mr. Travers, they went after you, sir,to look for you, sir, in a motorboat.
title: Top Hat

text: - Mr. Beddini, too?- Yes, sir, all three of them...
title: Top Hat

text: but they won't be back this evening, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: We took the precautionof removing the gasoline.
title: Top Hat

text: Thank you, Bates.
title: Top Hat

text: What is it, my good man?
title: Top Hat

text: Yes. I'm masquerading.
title: Top Hat

text: Don't you understand English?
title: Top Hat

text: You don't understand English?
title: Top Hat

text: Well, I've been waiting for an opportunitylike this since my childhood.
title: Top Hat

text: You frozen-faced flatfoot.
title: Top Hat

text: And grazie to you if it comes to that,you stultified shrimp.
title: Top Hat

text: Can I help it if you looklike a mildewed donkey?
title: Top Hat

text: I'm adoring this.And grazie to you, since you insist.
title: Top Hat

text: You see, I happen to be breaking the law.I admit it wholeheartedly...
title: Top Hat

text: but, of course, you would never know that,you fish-faced nincompoop.
title: Top Hat

text: Good night.
title: Top Hat

text: I arrest you for masqueradingas a gondolier.
title: Top Hat

text: I further charge you with insultingan officer with vile names...
title: Top Hat

text: according to Rule Three, Section Threeof the law dealing with delinquents.
title: Top Hat

text: Beg your pardon, signoro,the carnival is beginning.
title: Top Hat

text: Shall I serve nowor will you wait for the groom?
title: Top Hat

text: I don't think the groomwill be here tonight.
title: Top Hat

text: - Very good, sir.- Very good? It's perfect.
title: Top Hat

text: I still feel a little guiltybeing here with you...
title: Top Hat

text: while Alberto's out looking for us.
title: Top Hat

text: Let's eat, drink, and be merry,for tomorrow we have to face him.
title: Top Hat

text: The hour of reckoning is at hand.
title: Top Hat

text: Beddini is about to settle his accounts.
title: Top Hat

text: Skipper, will you tellmy husband we're here?
title: Top Hat

text: He's the one with his mouth closed.
title: Top Hat

text: Listen, you two idiots,Alberto is as mad as a drunken toreador.
title: Top Hat

text: - Where is he?- He's gone up to the room.
title: Top Hat

text: If you take my advice, you'll takethe first plane back to London pronto.
title: Top Hat

text: Not until I've asked Mr. Beddini for hiswife's hand. Do you think he'll accept me?
title: Top Hat

text: - Mr. Hardwick.- What do you want?
title: Top Hat

text: I regret to report, my dear sir,that your manservant has been arrested.
title: Top Hat

text: - Bates? Really?- Yes, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: He would have spent the whole nightin jail if I had not bailed him out.
title: Top Hat

text: You don't mean it.
title: Top Hat

text: Come in.
title: Top Hat

text: At last.
title: Top Hat

text: The little birdies have come flying backto the rooster.
title: Top Hat

text: Mr. Beddini, we want to explainthis whole thing to you.
title: Top Hat

text: I will not listen to any excuses,not even the truth.
title: Top Hat

text: Jerry, Madge,I have the most amazing news.
title: Top Hat

text: A few days ago,my invaluable manservant, Bates...
title: Top Hat

text: Allow me to tell them, sir, please.
title: Top Hat

text: Quiet, your turn will come later.
title: Top Hat

text: A few days ago,my invaluable manservant, Bates...
title: Top Hat

text: The needle has gotten stuck in a crack.You tell it, Bates.
title: Top Hat

text: Thank you, madam.
title: Top Hat

text: You see, Miss Dale, Mr. Hardwick thoughtyou were a dangerous woman.
title: Top Hat

text: And he asked me to follow youin case you did something dangerous.
title: Top Hat

text: - Follow me?- Yes, miss.
title: Top Hat

text: And in order to put you off the scent,I thought of many little disguises.
title: Top Hat

text: This evening, I metMr. Beddini and Miss Tremont...
title: Top Hat

text: and fearingthat they might recognize me...
title: Top Hat

text: I turned my collar around...
title: Top Hat

text: like this.
title: Top Hat

text: And very cleverly, I became a clergyman.
title: Top Hat

text: You are the one who married us.
title: Top Hat

text: Yes, sir.
title: Top Hat

text: Then we've never been really married?
title: Top Hat

text: Precisely, miss.
title: Top Hat

text: Well, Mr. Beddini...
title: Top Hat

text: what are you doingin this young lady's room?
title: Top Hat
